definition: to invite a snub/to court a rebuff
to invite/to provoke/to demand or ask for/to send armed forces to suppress/to denounce or condemn/to marry (a woman)/to discuss or study

sentences.english: Studies the intelligent spot, do not have a joke backfire.
sentences.chinese: 學聰明點吧，不要自討沒趣。

sentences.english: Can I please go to work and humiliate myself now?
sentences.chinese: 我能去上班順便自討沒趣了嗎？

sentences.english: I went to the General office, and ate dirt.
sentences.chinese: 我到總辦事處去，結果自討沒趣。

sentences.english: If that person can't figure out who are you, aren't you just asking for trouble?
sentences.chinese: 要是人家想不出或猜不着你是誰，豈非自討沒趣？

sentences.english: She know how to score off people who ask difficult question.
sentences.chinese: 她很會讓那些給她出難題的人自討沒趣。

definition: (dialect) hen/prostitute/(Tw) interfering/nosy/busybody (from Taiwanese 家婆, Tai-lo pr. [ke-pô])
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
lit. either the fish dies or the net splits/a life and death struggle (idiom)
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
to leak (of air)/to go flat (of a tire)/to vent one's anger
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
to make fun of/to seek diversion
